Articles.Content:
I've been futzing about all today, not doing anything KSP-wise, because of the approaching Hypetrain.

I don't want to put a lot of time into my career save, because I'll probably start from scratch as soon as .25 drops. And I don't want to spend a lot of time designing a new plane, because I'm probably going to want to revise all of my designs once the stockified SP+ parts show up.

But it just occured to me: now is the perfect time to have a bash at all of those mods that I'd been avoiding on the grounds that my computer couldn't cope with them. If they break my save and/or make my game terminally crash-happy, so what? I'm going to be scrubbing and reinstalling everything in a couple of weeks anyway.

Kerbtown here we come!
Forget Kerbtown, Kerbal Konstructs replaces it and of course Kerbin Side comes with it.
Been using kerbinside and KK the last couple of days. Really good fun. Launching at various latitudes introduces some fun elements and also takes a bit of the early biome grind out of the equation.

Been using kerbinside and KK the last couple of days. Really good fun. Launching at various latitudes introduces some fun elements and also takes a bit of the early biome grind out of the equation.

That's one of the reasons I requested a feature in KK that you can't launch from someplace you haven't been. I don't like that "cheaty" science grab. But don't worry, I included in the request an "unlock all" button for those that do.
